resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson commented on pull request #5492: ARROW-6649: [R] print methods for Array, ChunkedArray, Table, RecordBatch
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5492
 
 
   See the readme and the new tests for example output. 
   
   This patch also fixes a validation bug in `dictionary()`, aliases that to `DictionaryType$create`, and adds default arguments.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on pull request #5492: ARROW-6649: [R] print methods for Array, ChunkedArray, Table, RecordBatch
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5492#discussion_r327832016
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/tests/testthat/test-RecordBatch.R
 ##########
 @@ -120,6 +120,23 @@ test_that("head and tail on RecordBatch", {
   expect_identical(as.data.frame(tail(batch, -4)), tail(tbl, -4))
 })
 
+test_that("RecordBatch print method", {
+  expect_output(
+    print(batch),
+    paste(
+      "RecordBatch",
+      "10 rows x 5 columns",
+      "$int <int32>",
+      "$dbl <double>",
+      "$lgl <bool>",
+      "$chr <string>",
+      "$fct <dictionary<values=string, indices=int8, ordered=0>>",
 
 Review comment:
   Just for the record, R doesn't have boolean values? ("ordered=0")

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5492#discussion_r327831584
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/man/dictionary.Rd
 ##########
 @@ -4,14 +4,15 @@
 \alias{dictionary}
 \title{Create a dictionary type}
 \usage{
-dictionary(index_type, value_type, ordered = FALSE)
+dictionary(index_type = int32(), value_type = utf8(),
+  ordered = FALSE)
 }
 \arguments{
-\item{index_type}{index type, e.g. \code{\link[=int32]{int32()}}}
+\item{index_type}{A DataType for the indexes (default \code{\link[=int32]{int32()}})}
 
 Review comment:
   "indexes" or "indices"?

bkietz commented on pull request #5492: ARROW-6649: [R] print methods for Array, ChunkedArray, Table, RecordBatch
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5492#discussion_r327833613
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/R/dictionary.R
 ##########
 @@ -39,20 +39,21 @@ DictionaryType <- R6Class("DictionaryType",
     ordered = function() DictionaryType__ordered(self)
   )
 )
+DictionaryType$create <- function(index_type = int32(),
+                                  value_type = utf8(),
+                                  ordered = FALSE) {
+  assert_is(index_type, "DataType")
+  assert_is(value_type, "DataType")
+  shared_ptr(DictionaryType, DictionaryType__initialize(index_type, value_type, ordered))
+}
 
 #' Create a dictionary type
 #'
-#' @param index_type index type, e.g. [int32()]
-#' @param value_type value type, probably [utf8()]
-#' @param ordered Is this an ordered dictionary ?
+#' @param index_type A DataType for the indexes (default [int32()])
 
 Review comment:
   nit:
   ```suggestion
   #' @param index_type A DataType for the indices (default [int32()])
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org
